column4: if a network card can ping it's local IP (192.168.x.y), yet it doesn't respond to the ethernet cable being plugged/unplugged, is there any chance that it's not a faulty cable? (because it works in windows but who knows)
if you can ping your own IP it means your computer has contact with the router so the cable should be intact
although if pinging localhost works but pinging your IP doesn't then something might be wrong
